result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald D Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court costs and victim witness surchrges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid by 8/18/2018.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Restitution set at zero.

Defendant to provide a  DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.
Provide Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: No reply from surety or defendant. AR
9/2/14 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.  at
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Ronald D Howard in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  John F. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
No corrections made to the PSI.
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 3 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 8/18/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 8/18/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-6 month drivers license suspension
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Part time employment or education
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Complete 10 hours of community service
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

14RM035352  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/17/2014

Defendant Ronald D Howard in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

NO FILE IN COURT.   Defendant appears in Court on a violation with a positive test for THC.  Court finds the defendant is not in compliance with monitoring.  Court orders $150 of the bail FORFEITED.  Bail to remain the same.  Defendant to post another $150 cash TOT to Justice Point same conditions.  Case remains set for 8-18-14.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
Per Chief Judge Directive of 14-08, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2014 this case will be assigned to Branch 15, Judge J. D. Watts, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Ronald D Howard in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant has been in an accident and is on a number of medications.  Attorney Kohn is asking for an adjournment of the sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald D Howard in court with attorney Steven R Kohn.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  

On motion of the defense, Court orders a presentence investigation report.    There is a possibility of incarceration, if so, defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence at the next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Ronald D Howard in court with attorney Steven R Kohn.  Karen A Loebel for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds  Plea hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Ronald D Howard in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. 
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Ronald D Howard in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Paul Hauer for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Konkol, Br. 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/5/14.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Ronald D Howard in court with attorney Anne Jaspers.  Defendant Ronald D Howard in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
